intro: Ononis gines-lopezii, commonly known as the Gines-Lopez's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
